data.title: Olympic Games Medallists
data.meta_description: United Kingdom Track and Field All-Time Lists - Olympic Games Medallists - Cycling.

Tandem - Professional

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this 2000 metres event on the programme of the 1900 Games. The first three were Harrie Meyers NED & Gian Fernando Tommaselli ITA 11.4, A. Huber GER & ?. Seidl AUT, Edmond Jacquelin FRA & Jean-Baptiste Louvet FRA.

440 Yards

GOLD SILVER BRONZE 1904 Marcus Hurley USA 31.8 Burton Downing USA +1.5 lgths Teddy Billington USA +0.5 wl

1/3 Mile

GOLD SILVER BRONZE 1904 Marcus Hurley USA 43.8 Burton Downing USA +1 lgth Teddy Billington USA

1/3 Mile - Professional

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. In the first competition the first three were William Fenn USA 43.4, Frank Kramer USA +5 lgths, Menus Bedell USA +8 lgths. In the second competition the first three were Oliver Dorlon USA 42.6, G. Colett USA, F. Schepps AUS.

660 Yards

GOLD SILVER BRONZE 1908 Victor Johnson GBR 51.2 Emile Demangel FRA Karl Neumer GER

880 Yards

GOLD SILVER BRONZE 1904 Marcus Hurley USA 1:09.0 Teddy Billington USA +1.5 lgths Burton Downing USA +0.5 lgths

880 Yards - Handicap

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. The first three were W. Snider USA 1:02.8 (off 70y), Henry Wittman USA (off 70y), Teddy Billington USA (scratch).

880 Yards - Professional

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. The first three were Frank Kramer USA 1:09.0, William Fenn USA, John Bedell USA +8 lgths.

880 Yards - Professional Handicap

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. The first three were Oliver Dorlon USA 58.8 (off 35y), John Bedell USA +2 lgths (off 15y), Eddy Root USA +2 lgths (off 35y).

2/3 Mile - Professional

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. The first three were Frank Kramer USA 1:46.6, William Fenn USA 1:46.6, Floyd Krebs USA.

1 Mile

GOLD SILVER BRONZE 1904 Marcus Hurley USA 2:41.6 Burton Downing USA +5 lgths Teddy Billington USA +4 in

1 Mile - Handicap

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. The first three were Oscar Goerke USA 2:13.0 (off 20y), Henry Wittman USA (off 90y), Fred Grinham USA (off 100y).

1 Mile - Junior

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. The first three were W. Snider USA 2:45.8, Frank Bizzoni USA, Henry Wittman USA.

1 Mile - Professional

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. In the first competition the first three were Fred Bowler USA 2:13.6, G. Colett USA, Joe Fogler USA. In the second competition the first three were F. Cadwell USA 2:19.0, Menus Bedell USA +1 lgth, G. Colett USA +1 lgth. In the third competition the first three were William Fenn USA 2:32.4, Fred Bowler USA, Eddy Root USA.

1 Mile - Professional Handicap

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. In the first competition the first three were Floyd Krebs USA 2:17.8 (off 60y), F. Cadwell USA +0.5 lgth (off 40y), John Bedell USA (off 20y). In the second competition the first three were John Bedell USA 2:07.6 (off 20y), Eddy Root USA +2in (off 40yd), Oliver Dorlon USA +4in (off 60y).

2000 Metres

GOLD SILVER BRONZE 1896 Paul Masson FRA 4:58.2 Stamatios Nikolopoulos GRE 5:00.2 Léon Flameng FRA

2000 Metres - Professional

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1900 Games. The first three were Harrie Meyers NED 4:32.4, Tom Cooper USA, Edmond Jacquelin FRA.

3000 Metres - Professional

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1900 Games. The first three were Mathieu Cordang NED ???/13.6, Paul Bourotte FRA, Victor Thuau FRA.

3000 Metres - Professional Handicap

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1900 Games. The first three were Pierre Chevalier FRA 3:47.2 (off 235m), ?. Moussier FRA (off 220m), Charles Jue FRA (off 225m).

2 Miles

GOLD SILVER BRONZE 1904 Burton Downing USA 4:57.8 Oscar Goerke USA +1 wl Marcus Hurley USA

2 Miles - Professional Handicap

Although not listed in modern sources, early sources include this event on the programme of the 1904 Games. The first three were Eddy Root USA 4:17.0 (off 50y), John Bedell USA (off 50y), Menus Bedell USA (off 50y).
